meanings.definition: A safety device that stops the flow of electricity in a circuit when there is too much current.
meanings.sent1: The fuse in the circuit prevented a fire by stopping the electricity flow.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to check the fuse box if the lights suddenly go out.
meanings.sent3: The fuse and the wire had a chat about who had the more shocking job.
meanings.sent4: Her quick thinking acted like a fuse, cutting off the dangerous situation.
meanings.sent5: The fuse, like a silent guardian, protected the house from electrical damage.

meanings.definition: To join or blend together by melting.
meanings.sent1: She used heat to fuse the pieces of metal together.
meanings.sent2: The artist will fuse different colors to create a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent3: The chocolate and marshmallows fused into a gooey mess on the campfire.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was so strong, it seemed to fuse their hearts together.
meanings.sent5: The two metals began to fuse under the intense heat of the torch.

meanings.sent1: The flavors fuse together to create a delicious dish.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the two companies will fuse into one large corporation.
meanings.sent3: The music and laughter fused into a joyful symphony.
meanings.sent4: Their minds seemed to fuse, coming up with brilliant ideas together.
meanings.sent5: The colors of the sunset began to fuse into a breathtaking display.
